website_summaries.verdict: This tandem stroller offers a whopping 12 ways to ride, making it one of the most convenient options on the market. A smart solution for kids of varying ages.
pros: Can be used as a regular tandem stroller with two seats or adjusted to accommodate an older sibling with a bench-style seat or standing platform
Fits two Graco Click Connect infant car seats
Multiple seating configurations allow parents to choose the most comfortable option for kids
cons: Heavy and bulky even when folded
Can be difficult to keep an eye on the front seat with a car seat fitted in the rear

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: I hate this stroller. I wish my hubby would let me return it. The handle bar is too low. I kick the step in between the wheels all the time. The so-called cup holder is so small none of my beverages can fit. And the storage underneath is impossible to to put stuff in and out easily w two kids strapped in. Hate it hate it. Thx for listening.
customer_reviews.author: JEN

customer_reviews.title: So far I am in love with this stroller
customer_reviews.text: So far I am in love with this stroller. I have a three year old and a new born. My three year old can easily pull up the front cup holder to get in and out. I haven't used the stand up position, but it is simple to put it in that position. I do wish that the seat by the handle would recline back a little, my newborn falls forward a little. But it easily changes to a position to place her car seat in. I do wish it was a little smaller when folded up, but there is probably not a double stroller out there that would be. Graco is my favorite traveler brand!
customer_reviews.author: reba lamb

customer_reviews.title: -1 star If I could
customer_reviews.text: I'd give this stroller a -1 star if I could. this stroller was extremely hard to turn and maneuver!! I wish I had spent a little more for a better quality stroller. I had to lift the stroller for each turn I wanted to make.....family day out turned into a nightmare as a single mom with 2 small kids I was struggling with it and couldn't enjoy the time with my kids. DO NOT BUY unless you plan to go one way only with no turns. It is bulky and a bit heavy too but all I can remember is not being able to actually make it stroll it was terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Addicted2shopping

customer_reviews.title: Not user friendly
customer_reviews.text: Really difficult to figure out how to configure. I have an older Graco infant seat and I assumed it would work with this model but it doesn't, so you likely will need to have a new infant click connect seat. It also doesn't do very well on anything but completely smooth pavement. Wish I would have spent the money on a more rugged option that would work for longer walks.
customer_reviews.author: AMS80

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this for me for mother's day and I couldn't be more pleased with it. I take it everywhere with me. I honestly just wish the cup holder in the back was a little bit wider to fit my water bottle into it.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Arkeketa

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: I got this and did not read that the car seats were not included. That is my fault. I would not have bothered to buy it otherwise because I have two expensive non compatible car seats already. This doesn’t even fit in my trunk so I am just using around the block. It is nice and simple though. But the additional car seats are like $199 so I will wait until my daughter grows into it.
customer_reviews.author: N. Trujillo

customer_reviews.title: It’s heavy and bulky
customer_reviews.text: This stroller sounds great but I wished I read everything and double check the dimensions. 1) it took my whole space in the suv. I have to take parts out the fit it in. If you don’t have a mini van, xl suv or truck don’t get this it won’t fit for mid six suv. 2) it’s heavy, 33 lbs. if your thinking of trying to lift this with and car seat you will need to put the car seat first there is no way you can do both. Props for all these ways for a stroller. It got me sad it’s not what I wanted
customer_reviews.author: Min Ma

customer_reviews.title: Over all this a good stroller.
customer_reviews.text: Over all this a good stroller... it is massive and hard to get into a car trunk. I have a new Subaru Legacy and the only way I can get it in my trunk is to take off the drink holder and foot rest. Also the straps are very cheaply made. Other then those two things, I like the stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Website description is correct in everything about this stroller, but I needed something better. I purchased the Modes Dual and absolutely love it way better than the ReadyToGrow. The handle was very short, so I could not jog or even fast walk without my feet hitting the bottom. The cup holder was too small, and the seats are stationary. Modes Dual has wayyy more options, and is a better fit for me. Highly recommend Modes Dual Connect and Click, but not ReadyToGrow.
customer_reviews.author: Abigail Kennon

customer_reviews.title: A great double stroller!!
customer_reviews.text: We we’re looking for a stroller that could face in towards us for our 1 year old, and our 5 year old could sit in the front facing seat, there was not a big selection that has the seat facing into the parent. So I bought this one and we love it! It is so versatile for when little one gets bigger, and there is so much room at the bottom, it was pretty easy to assemble, and I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: hanna

customer_reviews.title: Works great for our family
customer_reviews.text: It’s heavy but that’s expected for a double stroller. We bought another one from amazon but couldn’t resister this one. It works much better for our family and my 4 month old son actually likes walks now that he can see me. Only thing I would change is give the parents another cup holder and make them a little bigger. As you can see a gatorade bottle fits upside down
customer_reviews.author: JoDina

customer_reviews.title: Why is it so big when folded
customer_reviews.text: I feel like they could've designed this to be more compact and lightweight somehow. It fits in our Honda CR-V trunk but you take off the cup holders and canopy every time you load it. It's good for a very specific use case I guess, one person and 2 infants/toddlers. But if there's every 2 or more of us going for a walk we tend to just put 2 single strollers in the trunk rather than lug this monstrous stroller around. Another important thing to note is the cupholder for parents is way too small, it would only hold something like a plastic dixie cup, no adult-sized water bottle.
customer_reviews.author: givitumee

customer_reviews.title: Top quality, comfort and safety of little ones!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for newborn twin nephews. They are 7 months old now and seats/stroller still look brand new. Amazing quality and easily adjustable to growth of infants. I know they are secure and well protected when in these seats. Not sure about how easily adjustable the stroller will be throughout the different stages, because we haven’t reached that milestone yet, but I’m sure I will be just as impressed as I am with the seats.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Beth Wentz

customer_reviews.title: Large and bulky!
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is very large and barely fits in my daughter SUV, the tray must be removed from the front to make it fit. It works fine with her toddler in the front and the baby seat attached at top but it doesn't compare mobility wise to her previous single stroller. You won't be turning on a dime with this set-up! I would have gladly paid a little more for one easier to steer if there is such a thing.
customer_reviews.author: Kellieym

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but heavy and bulky
customer_reviews.text: I love the convenience this product offers. There’s a solution for any type of seating arrangement you could possibly need. However, when folded it takes up a lot of “trunk” room in my Chevrolet Traverse, and it’s very heavy and difficult to pull out of the car and load back in. Not easily doable when recovering from birth. The pros definitely outweigh the cons, and I have already recommended this to others.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin Knighton

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great. I mean its a beast, its a double stroller so don't expect it to weight 5 lbs. lol. I love it, my only complaint would be I don't like that the straps for the shoulder and waist come apart so you have to feed it through every time if that makes sense. Otherwise for the price its great.
customer_reviews.author: Jocelynnnnn

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: My grand babies are 10 months a part, so this Is perfect for taking both them out. The oldest sits right up front and the younger ones car seat snaps into the back. She does not have to be disturbed when moving her from the car to stroller. But you do have to have a certain car seat to fit in the stroller. My daughter in love, loves this stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Greenhalgh

customer_reviews.title: Works great for 2 kids
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my grandchildren, one in a newborn car seat and one in the regular stroller seat. It works great and the car seats fits perfectly (also Graco). It is a little hard to maneuver in the driveway, which is dirt, but on the pavement it works great and steers easily.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Ann

customer_reviews.title: Bulky and heavy
customer_reviews.text: In theory I thought this stroller would work ,but it's just not practical. It's extremely heavy which I did expect bc it is a double stroller but it's extremely bulky and hard to maneuver while out and about. Wish I would've researched the product more before hand.
customer_reviews.author: jessie torres

customer_reviews.title: Assembly is not easy!
customer_reviews.text: Overall not bad... but assembly was not easy as the parents tray mount had issues ( I still was not able to mount it), Also rear wheel caps would not fix and they just fall off. And front seat is pretty small. Honestly I have graco single stroller as well and I loved it .. but this one not so much! So 3 star from me!
customer_reviews.author: Rabab Durrani

customer_reviews.title: Best stroller!
customer_reviews.text: Got as a baby shower gift! LOVVEEEE IT! 2yr old and 2month old. When infant is awake I have her closer to me, but if she’s sleeping I can easily move her to the front and let my toddler sit closer to me so we can talk. So easy to use. One touch break with my foot is great too.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Takes up a lot of trunk space
customer_reviews.text: This stroller takes up a lot of space in your trunk. We recently upgraded to a van and it takes up almost all of the trunk. Its not super lightweight but it could be worse. If your heavier child is in the front its a bit hard to manuever. Pluses: compatibility with the graco click connect system and several different seat configurations.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Cris

customer_reviews.title: Pretty happy!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great for two young kids and the bottom holds a lot!!! I just wish that the handle was like a few inches longer and it had 2 cup holders. Can be frustrating sometimes when the “side catch” keeps getting stuck when trying to unfold it. But all in all it’s been great especially for long days out and about.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Works great for us!
customer_reviews.text: This stroller has allowed me to walk and go out with my 2 year old and 5 1⁄2 month old. My only issue is, I wish there was an age suggested for the infant seat. I’m thinking when they can sit up on their own, but who knows?
customer_reviews.author: mandy

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS
customer_reviews.text: My mother purchased the other Graco double stroller for us before baby #2 came, you know the one that is $350+. My sister-in-law had this one for her kids and I was amazed how quiet it was on the street and sidewalk. We decided to sell the other stroller (sorry mom) and buy this one and so far we love it.
customer_reviews.author: E.Mummert

customer_reviews.title: Good stroller, but bulky
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I did a lot of research to find a double stroller. We ended up choosing this one and we're pretty happy with our purchase. I'm petite and I can still maneuver this stroller. The basket at the bottom is very large. My only complaint is that it takes up our entire trunk when it's folded, but that comes with the territory of having a double stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Susanne

customer_reviews.title: What I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my kids are 11 months apart. 2 and 1. They both fit so well, carseat and everything. It was worth every penny. I love this stroller. So much storage room, really easy to use. I set it up myself and it only took about 30 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mrs. Parison

customer_reviews.title: Makes life easy with multiple kids
customer_reviews.text: I have a infant, a 2 year old, and a 4 year old. Its hard going places with 3 kids but this double stroller makes it more feasible to get out and about. It fits in my 2012 equinox folded and also fits in my 2018 expedition open. I love it
customer_reviews.author: MOTHER OF DRAGONS

customer_reviews.title: Worth my investment.
customer_reviews.text: I really like how easy it is to fold and unfold. It can be hard to turn around corners or to turn it around, but it's also a double stroller, it's to be expected. Only thing I would like is if it were a little lighter so I could get it in and out of my car easier. But overall it's pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: G. Branson

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work with Chicco Keyfit 30 car seat
customer_reviews.text: Bought this stroller wish it would fit on the chicco keyfit 30 car seat. Unfortunately it doesn’t. We bought 3 different adapters, none of them worked. Very disappointing back and forth. Wish it could worked out!
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: After a year.
customer_reviews.text: The Click connect feature is the reason we got this stroller. The carrier does not secure into the stroller 1/2 as good as the jogging stroller we have. Once the carrier is clicked into the jogger you can lift the entire thing while holding the carrier. Not the case with this one. Once clicked in the carrier is not set and shifts around. Makes us uneasy.
customer_reviews.author: H Aldrich

customer_reviews.title: Versatile stroller, not too bulky
customer_reviews.text: This is a great stroller for 2 kids - plenty of seating positions and not too bulky when folded in the back of the car. The quality is great - highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: Stroller is very long even when folded up
customer_reviews.text: I would give this stroller 5 stars if it weren't for the size of the thing when it's folded up. It is my fault for not checking the dimensions before purchasing but I drive a Chevy equinox which has a good sized rear storage area which has always accommodated our larger strollers with room to spare but this stroller only fits if one of the rear seats is down and with two car seats well, that obviously doesn't work. Really disappointed with this purchase and will definitely be giving this stroller away and buying one that is a reasonable length when folded up.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Bulky and heavy !
customer_reviews.text: Stroller is bulky and hard to turn with two kids in it . Also very heavy ! This is the first double stroller I’ve purchased so I’m not able to compare to others but I’m not excited to use this often .
customer_reviews.author: Kavale

customer_reviews.title: Great for long days out with 2 under 2
customer_reviews.text: I have a newborn and a toddler and this stroller makes it manageable to go out of the house alone. That being said, it is very large and heavy. Great for longer trips out and about (mall, theme park etc). Lots of storage room. But not ideal for small cars or any trips you need more trunk space because this thing will use it all. I have a CRV and it fits (barely) in the trunk.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: The best stroller jve ever used
customer_reviews.text: Literally the best stroller I've ever used!!!:) I am amazed at how easy it is to put together and so easy to use! Surprised I can fit 3 kids in perfectly!!:) well deserved of 5 stars and i have zero complaints!:)
customer_reviews.author: Kimberlee Lowe

customer_reviews.title: Heavy in weight but even more so in features!
customer_reviews.text: This has got to be the best invention ever! Having twins in December of 2016 and trying to find convenience and portability options for newbie parents this was a definite highlight of all of our purchases! Super easy to open, easy to click and go...really. That easy. If I had one complaint..and it's truly unavoidable ...the overall stroller is heavy when loading and unloading.
customer_reviews.author: Weewillowmom

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended. So many functions.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my son and daughter in law. Folds easy, maneuvers easy and so many positions to fit the situation. Not much bigger than a normal stroller when folded. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Kim E.

customer_reviews.title: Love this stroller
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I have done a lot of research on double strollers. We came across this one at Target one day and were able to test it put in person. The stroller is very sturdy. Was very easy to put together. I think it will be perfect. We also purchased the graco snugride 30 so hopefully that works well with this stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality, but very large.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great stroller for someone with 2 kids.. however, it is very large even when folded up. It easily takes up the back of my Honda pilot, but my kids are comfortable in it and it's well made. The front wheels have brakes too, so just be aware of that. I love that feature but was unsure why it kept wanting to go in circles and dragging on one side. Oops!
customer_reviews.author: Jaimie Santora

customer_reviews.title: Not all parts can be replaced...
customer_reviews.text: Great stroller, but recently the basket undercarriage part got ripped and when I called in, they said this was one of the non-replaceable parts (even though it can snap on and off). This is a very important part of a stroller, to not have a replacement, so make sure you know the irreplaceable parts b4 you buy. I bought mine March 2019 and trying to find another carriage so I dont have to buy a whole new stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Elisha Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Poor design
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be a great product, but terrible design. I have a newborn and toddler. My toddler likes using the standing and sitting option on the bench. When we use the infant car seat rear facing on the front side with my toddler sitting on the bench it's not comfortable as his back is hitting the infant car seat! The bench is so wide yet he can only use half the bench. I was there was an option for us to move the bench forward or move the car seat forward to have more space. Disappointed by this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for! 100%. Works great with my 50 lb. Toddler and my click base infant seat. Love that we can go on walks together.
customer_reviews.author: Kirsten Young

customer_reviews.title: Great size
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together and surprisingly light weight. It actually folds nicely too. Perfect for my 2 year old and newborn.
customer_reviews.author: KatelynTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Good price, light weight, and fun for kids.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Easy to handle and push, 12 positions. Fun for the kids Cons: Specs not spacious enough for when a toddler (2yr old) is riding no matter the position. Her feet touches the floor when sitting in the front and car seat is attached in the back and not a lot of butt space when she is sitting in the back and the car seat is in the front. So she stands enjoys standing most of the time in the back when car seat is in the front.
customer_reviews.author: ezequiel colon

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic but not compatible with certain snugride models
customer_reviews.text: Love the versatility. It is heavy, and I'm kind of a weakling, but I can work with it. It is not compatible with the snug ride 30/35, etc. But I also worked around that, since that's the car seat I have. So far it seems like a good fit, just wish it was a bit lighter and that the product info was clearer about which car seats it is compatible with.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Shapiro

customer_reviews.title: We should have bought this a long time ago!
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is amazing. We were looking for a double stroller with convenience and we found it. It was super easy to put together. It is perfect for our 3yr old and 4 month old to ride together. I especially love the multi riding positions!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but great
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast! But was easy to assemble and glides great. Its heavy! That's my only complaint is that lifting it into my trunk is a chore. But for the price it's totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jenette Green

customer_reviews.title: The Cadillac of strollers.
customer_reviews.text: I'm expecting my 2nd little one in 8 weeks. And my first son is 2 and weighs 30 lbs. So far with just him in it, it works like a charm and is super easy to maneuver. I cant wait to have both my babies in it. Got it for a great price too!! It's like the Cadillac of strollers.
customer_reviews.author: Paxton

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old son . Cant fit in it so how I am supposed to seat my two kids. The seat is way too small
customer_reviews.author: susana  Larios

customer_reviews.title: Good double stroller
customer_reviews.text: The stroller is definitely not lightweight but I really love it! It took some time getting used to it but we use it everyday for a walks. It's just really big and barely fits in my car, but I feel like that's with most double strollers. Once I figured out how to unlock the wheels, it rides really smooth and turns really well. My boys love it and so do I.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Easy to handle with one hand
customer_reviews.text: With two little boys (2 yrs and 5 mo) it's wonderful to have this stroller that is so easy to use. And the 2 year old loves being able to be up front.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but perfect for mommy's with 2 close in age
customer_reviews.text: I love this for both my babies it's big enough and lots of room. Only downfall is that its heavy and bulky. You need a big car for this. Other than that I love this double stroller. Even my 1 year old agrees. He loves it so much he does not want to come out of it and it's very comfortable for him.
customer_reviews.author: irene Valdez

customer_reviews.title: Big
customer_reviews.text: This thing is big. Even folded it's big. Not for anyone with a small trunk or car. If you you have two kids this one will fit down a store aisle much more easily the the double wide variety. Easy to put together, but heavy to lift for the wife. We used this for about 5 months it works great, but the second our oldest kid decided she wanted to walk instead of sit in a stroller we switched to the single stroller for the baby.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Oates

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this stroller! It came super fast and was really easy to install/set up! You can close the stroller with one hand and is very durable and sturdy. I definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Alexa Sorensen

customer_reviews.title: Too bulky and heavy it feels like turning a tank
customer_reviews.text: It’s too bulky, if you have a crossover it won’t fit laying flat which makes it hard to store it at the back and less room for groceries or anything else. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: Why send more?...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome for price! Did not have the funds for a $700 stroller! Easy set up and great for strolls on even pavement or Disneyland!
customer_reviews.author: JljmP

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller, tiny cup holder
customer_reviews.text: Very happy smooth ride. Fits in the back of my Nissan rogue with room left over for my 80 pound dog. My only complaint is the tiny tiny cup holder for the parents. i had to look for weeks to find a new water bottle to fit in it.
customer_reviews.author: zach Unruh

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed! Should have bought it sooner!
customer_reviews.text: Just got this in a few days ago and it was fairly easy to put together. Really happy with how well it folds up closed- although it is really large but that was to be expected. Kids love it and it has quite a bit of space for our stuff at the bottom. Honestly the only complaint I have is the wheels are plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Menard

customer_reviews.title: Love this Stroller!!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and fold up. Very roomy and comfortable. Lots of storage under stroller but I did buy a mesh storage sleeve for each side for a little extra storage. also was compatible with the Graco car seat which was a plus!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent double stroller
customer_reviews.text: Nice double stroller. Not too big but I do have to take the front cup holder and sun visor off for it to fit in my trunk, not a huge deal. Fits my newborn while in her car seat and 2 year old perfect. Folds up nice and easy to unfold. Haven't used the bench yet.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Recine

customer_reviews.title: Won’t fit in car
customer_reviews.text: Great stroller but doesn’t fit in my hatchback which makes it useless.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love all the options this stroller gives you. It’s some what long and barely fits in my car. But I wouldn’t trade it for another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Pennington

customer_reviews.title: Design could be improved
customer_reviews.text: When two infant car seats are placed in the stroller, you can not see the baby who is furthest away from you. It seems the baby closest to you as you’re pushing should be at the lower elevation so you can see both babies at the same time. Also, after placing an infant car seat closest to the handles, you are left with little room to grasp the handles.
customer_reviews.author: SRock

customer_reviews.title: Great product for twins !
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a baby shower gift and my niece and nephew love it !
customer_reviews.author: jeannie holland

customer_reviews.title: Rocket Science
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter, who recently had a baby, seemed like a great idea with a newborn and a toddler. My daughter said she needed a Rocket Scientist to figure it out... "Mom, it took forever to put this together." Reason I gave it four stars, for the overall rating, was because of the degree of difficulty it took to put it together.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Vega-Carter

customer_reviews.title: I like it :)
customer_reviews.text: I have a two year old and a 2 month old. This thing is great for the both of them!
customer_reviews.author: Pang Thao

customer_reviews.title: Its okay...
customer_reviews.text: Its hard to maneuver snd drive with 2 kids. I also noticed my son is too big for the front and i dont like how the front cup holder cant lift up and down like his old stroller so we are always having to pull him in and out.
customer_reviews.author: gurina sandhu

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this stroller
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this stroller. It was worth every penny. I bought the Graco Snug Ride and a single stroller 2 years ago, and after having a second baby, I needed something to push both kids in. I couldn't be happier and my daughters love it. Its tough to push in my rocky driveway but a breeze everywhere else.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stroller!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome stroller for multiple children. I really like how the to space allows the children to look at you while pushing. If you have multiple small children like we do, a sit & stand stroller is a necessity!
customer_reviews.author: cmacaroy

customer_reviews.title: Good stroller but not comfortable to push
customer_reviews.text: The seating options are great. My toddler enjoys it. It gets the job done and has been enjoyable so far. The only drawback is that the handle is low and the standing area for the kid makes for limited leg movement for walker. I take walks in the evening and this drives me crazy because my foot kicks it almost every step. My first stroller was a running stroller so the handle being lower has been an adjustment as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Grace is excellent brand
customer_reviews.text: Stroller is good but not fitting in car trunk and the one we gotten is pulling to the right mostly so my arm aches every time I go with it
customer_reviews.author: Krishnaveni

customer_reviews.title: Durable and stylish
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble! Seems super comfy and heavy duty for winter. Easy to maneuver.
customer_reviews.author: Shay Chavaun

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to walk normally.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if I walk weird, but I struggle with stepping on the bars between the back wheels when I'm pushing the stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Amberlie

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I waited a while after purchasing to write this review, I wanted to make sure I loved it first - And I do!! Yes, it's big, yes it's heavy, but it's a double stroller.. It's kind of to be expected. Handles "off roading" great, fits well in stores, has great storage, and both my kids love it. It takes up a third of my 6 foot truck bed, but that's the trade off!
customer_reviews.author: Emily Latham

customer_reviews.title: Don’t purchase
customer_reviews.text: Worst stroller we’ve ever owned. Not much room for the front passenger when car seat is clicked in and terrible on anything but completely flat ground.
customer_reviews.author: Miranda Filipiak

customer_reviews.title: The cup holders don’t fit any adult cup. Also ...
customer_reviews.text: The cup holders don’t fit any adult cup. Also, there is only one cup holder. Also this is extremely heavy and bulky. Barely fits in the back of my SUV.
customer_reviews.author: Chantal

customer_reviews.title: WILL NOT FIT IN CAR TRUNKS
customer_reviews.text: Purchase after reading reviews and also since our Click Connect Car Seat would fit it and it wouldn't fit in any of our trunks. A Pontiac Grand Prix which has a nice size trunk BUT still wouldn't fit. The single Click Connect stroller did fit in all our cars BUT due to the cup holder (which is removable BUT it's screwed in & we wanted to be able to use it)
customer_reviews.author: Kim deRoos

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift and so far, it's good! And for a very reasonable price!
customer_reviews.author: Lumary Morales

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller!
customer_reviews.text: Very glad we bought this stroller! Great for my 5 month old and 3 year old. The bucket seat for the baby to sit in facing me was exactly what I was looking for. I love all the options so we can change the stroller as we need to. Easy to put together too.
customer_reviews.author: LSchub11

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and switch from putting the infant carrier in to strapping my baby in the seat. Only downfall I have is I only have one cup that fits in the parent cup holder. Most tumblers don’t fit.
customer_reviews.author: L. Lambert

customer_reviews.title: Bulky
customer_reviews.text: I love the stroller overall. However, it doesn’t collapse into a compact form - I have a SUV and I have to maneuver it into the back of my SUV. It’s the only downfall of the stroller. Overall, it’s a great stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Tanner

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller
customer_reviews.text: Love this stroller for my two year old and two month old. Love that I can put my two year old in front, or up closer to me if needed. It is a very big stroller and takes up almost the whole trunk in my small suv. It is a chore to get in the trunk by myself, but doable. Overall very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Love this stroller! It has been an absolute life saver with adjustaing to two boys. Highly suggest this stroller for any growing families!
customer_reviews.author: A. Smith

customer_reviews.title: It's an alright stroller
customer_reviews.text: Extremely bulky but if you have two babies it's worth the price
customer_reviews.author: Cree C

customer_reviews.title: Greco Ready2Grow LX Stroller
customer_reviews.text: This is not going to be small, but nothing is when you have to maneuver with twins. Folds and unfolds easily, but it still will be big. Without the front cupholders it'll fit in the back of an Impreza hatchback perfectly. Car seats click perfectly, it's sturdy and it's comfortable to walk with.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stroller broken and with incomplete pieces.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this from the Amazon Warehouse, it was new, but it arrived with a broken piece, some parts for the wheel missing, and one of the seats a has a lossen part. I am trying to contact gracco but is a waist of time.
customer_reviews.author: Romina

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend!!!
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is the best. It maneuvers marvelously. It was easy to put together. It had so many uses that you will get years out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel Kevin eckert

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your $$
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is NOT 33lbs. My child is 31 lbs and I have no problem lifting him. I can’t even lift this off the ground let alone get it into a car. I’m so disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect choice
customer_reviews.text: Great and does the job, the front seat short as my 1yr and half year old daughter is tall but I’m able to cruise with her and my newborn, since do large maneuvering is kind of hard, good price
customer_reviews.author: Nyia Monet

customer_reviews.title: I don't think I'd buy it again, it's large and clumsy, and I wasn't happy that the foot rests keep falling off.
customer_reviews.text: I like that it is easy to push but the plastic foot rests don't stay on. I don't like the little sun shields, they don't cover enough area.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Melville

customer_reviews.title: So glad I bought this
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is just what I was hoping for. It's vey large but that is to be expected for a double stroller. I love that it has so many options and is also easy enough to close down. We will be getting a lot of use out of this stroller for many years to come as it will be useful for my kids at all ages. Great quality stroller and worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: ABio

customer_reviews.title: Stroller missing key parts and some components don’t fit
customer_reviews.text: I can not even rate the product as the shipment is missing so many key components. Appalled by how many things are missing or don’t fit on this stroller. This was a gift and it is turning into an absolute nightmare! Hopefully in 5-7 days there will be an actual functioning stroller and I can try to rate the product itself.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The only knock I have for it is when folded ...
customer_reviews.text: The only knock I have for it is when folded up it still takes a considerable amount of cargo space, but that is part of every tandem style stroller. Just keep it in mind. Otherwise, it handles our 2 year old and our 6 month old very well and should cover them for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Hall

customer_reviews.title: Nice stroller only problem is big and little bulky
customer_reviews.text: Little big and bulky.. but serving it's purpose with our 3.5 years old and 4 months old.
customer_reviews.author: Akshata

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to assemble, folds up great, one hand to open it, pretty easy to adjust the seats differently, takes some getting used to to dive it because it’s long but that’s what you get with a 2 seater. Overall very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kassie Luze

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: Loved loved loved the stroller,better than my other duo glider double stroller..I'm very satisfied with my product..I would recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Maris

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I like it cause I can fit both my kids in it and they are comfortable!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Adorno

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great product, just wish the wheels weren’t only meant for the street and aren’t one hundred percent plastic.
customer_reviews.author: trevor

customer_reviews.title: Best double strollee
customer_reviews.text: Such an amazing stroller. Works great for my two kids, so many choices for them to sit.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Thompson

product_meta.title: Graco Ready2Grow LX Stroller | 12 Riding Options | Accepts 2 Graco SnugRide Infant Car Seats, Glacier
product_meta.description:
The most versatile stroller! With 12 riding options, from infant to youth, your kids will love getting out and about. The Ready2Grow Click Connect Stand and Ride Stroller accepts TWO Graco SnugRide Click Connect Infant Car Seats, America's #1 selling infant car seats, has a standing platform and bench seat for your older child, and a removable Face Time rear seat for some bonding time with baby! Stroller to be used only at walking speed. Product not intended for use while jogging, skating, etc. Never use bleach.

Care and Maintenance  *  Wash removable seat cushion in cold water on delicate cycle and line dry
   
   
 *  To clean stroller frame, use only household soap and warm water
   
   
 *  Never Use Bleach. Use light oil if wheels squeak.
   
   



BRAND STORY
By Graco
feature_bullets: Tandem stroller has 2 riding options for 2 children from infant to youth. Multi-position, reclining front seat reclines for baby's comfort

Removable face-time rear seat forinteraction with baby; The 1-hand fold with an automatic lock, large storage basket, and snack trays offer convenience, while the front swivel wheels allow for easy maneuverability
Front seat, bench seat and standing platform each hold child up to 50 pounds, rear seat holds up to 40 pounds; 3- and 5-point safety harnesses keep your children safe and secure

80% polyester and 20% cotton construction; For convenience, you can easily remove both seat cushions and machine-wash them in cold water on a delicate cycle; The double stroller frame wipes down easily with soap and warm water.Removable child's tray that holds 2 cups/ bottles and snacks; Adults have a tray with a pivoting cup holder; The large storage basket underneath is ideal for holding purses, groceries, and diaper bags
12 riding options for 2 children from infant to youth.
Front seat, bench seat and standing platform each hold child up to 50 pounds, rear seat holds up to 40 pounds. 3- and 5-point safety harnesses keep your children safe and secure.

Removable child's tray that holds 2 cups/ bottles and snacks. Adults have a tray with a pivoting cup holder. The large storage basket underneath is ideal for holding purses, groceries, and diaper bags.

Removable face-time rear seat for more interaction with baby. The 1-hand fold with an automatic lock, large storage basket, and snack trays offer convenience, while the front swivel wheels allow for easy maneuverability.

80% polyester and 20% cotton construction. For convenience, you can easily remove both seat cushions and machine-wash them in cold water on a delicate cycle. The stroller frame wipes down easily with soap and warm water.
